pull.title: net: No longer send local address in addrMe
pull.body:
After #8594 the addrFrom sent by a node is not used anymore at all, so don't bother sending it (it was already not used if it is an invalid address so this doesn't disadvantage older versions either).

Also mitigates the privacy issue in (#8616). It doesn't completely solve the issue as GetLocalAddress is also called in AdvertiseLocal, but at least when advertising addresses it stands out less as _our_ address.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
net: No longer send local address in addrMe

After #8594 the addrFrom sent by a node is not used anymore at all,

Also mitigates the privacy issue in (#8616). It doesn't completely solve
the issue as GetLocalAddress is also called in AdvertiseLocal, but at
least when advertising addresses it stands out less as *our* address.

events.body: utACK. The `addrFrom` value deserialized from the VERSION message (which this corresponds to) is unused.

issue.title: p2p sends local-scope addresses when IPv4 is behind NAT
issue.body:
Wireshark tells me I am sending my local-scope IPv6 address, when connecting over IPv4 (behind NAT)... :/

Context: #8594

events.body: This is backported in #8772, removing tag

issue.title: Do not add inbound peers to the address manager.
TODO for release notes 0.14.0
issue.body:
Post things here that need explicit mention in 0.14 release notes

I'd strongly prefer for pulls to just update `doc/release-notes.md` directly, but if they somehow slip by, mention them here.

Overview:
- [x] ZMQ on Windows (#8238) (done in wiki)
- Changed RPC calls:
  - [x] `getaddednodeinfo` got rid of first argument (#8272) (done in wiki)
  - [x] `getinfo` was deprecated (but not yet removed) (#8780) (done in wiki)
  - [x] `preciousblock` RPC call #6996
  - [x] `importmulti` RPC: #7551 
  - [x] `getmemoryinfo` #8753
  - [x] `setnetworkactive RPC (#8996)
- [x] Mention that the GUI confirmation target has been changed from the default of 25 to 6 (#9036).
- [x] Mempool dump to disk (#8448) (done in wiki)
- Several memory usage improvements 
  - [x] (shared pointers, LockedPool #8753)
  - [ ] Share unused mempool space with coin cache (#8610) 
- [x] Qt RPC nested commands: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7783 (done in wiki)
- [x] Qt sensitive data filter: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8877 (done in wiki)
- [x] Removal of priority estimation (#7730).
- [ ] Address relay changes (#8594, #8661, #8740).
- [x] Named RPC arguments (#8811).
- [x] Manual block file pruning (#7871)
- [x] Deprecate use of getrawtransaction for confirmed transactions with unspent outputs without -txindex (#9520).

~~**Note:** we're doing an experiment with editing the release notes draft in a github wiki.
The most up to date version of the release notes is thus at https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.14.0-Release-notes . Feel free to edit them there if you want to add any of these items.~~

issue.title: Do not add random inbound peers to addrman.
Backport Bitcoin PR#8708: net: have CConnman handle message sending
issue.body:
This is backport of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#8708.

This PR moves responsibility for sending messages from `CNode` to `CConnman`.

The naive (textual) application of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#8708 caused a problem with Dash-specific code.

This PR introduces `CNode::nSendVersion` member that is initialised to 0 initially and then set to minimum of version received in `verack` message and `PROTOCOL_VERSION` when initial handshake is complete (`verack` message received after sending `version` message). `CConnman::PushMessage()` method requires `nSendVersion` to be non-zero and fails with assertion failure otherwise. In order to send message during handshake, `CConnman::PushMessageWithVersion()` method is used, but it's used only for initial `version`, `verack` messaged as well as `reject` messages in case initial handshake fails. This is OK because no other messages are accepted before initial handshake is completed.

However, Dash sends `getsporks` message in another thread without waiting for initial handshake to complete. As a temporary solution to avoid assertion failure caused by zero `nSendVersion`, I had to use `CConnman::PushMessageWithVersion()` method with `INIT_PROTO_VERSION` version for this message as well. However, I think, more correct solution would be better to send `getsporks` message only after initial handshake is completed.

The original PR description follows.
---
See individual commits for more description. In particular, bitcoin/bitcoin@75ead75.

This (along with bitcoin/bitcoin#8707) fixes the current maxupload test failure.

issue.title: Backport Bitcoin PR#8740: net: No longer send local address in addrMe
issue.body:
This is backport of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#8740.

This PR is followup of #1593.

The original PR description follows.
---
After bitcoin/bitcoin#8594 the addrFrom sent by a node is not used anymore at all, so don't bother sending it (it was already not used if it is an invalid address so this doesn't disadvantage older versions either).

Also mitigates the privacy issue in (bitcoin/bitcoin#8616). It doesn't completely solve the issue as GetLocalAddress is also called in AdvertiseLocal, but at least when advertising addresses it stands out less as *our* address.

issue.title: BIP 155: addrv2 BIP proposal
issue.body: Proposal for wider v2 address messages. Last time this went around (as a github gist) there were some considerations still to be discussed, for lack of a working mailing list I'll post them here: ## Considerations * ''Client MAY store and gossip address formats that they do not know about'': does it ever make sense to gossip addresses outside a certain overlay network? Say, I2P addresses to Tor? I'm not sure. Especially for networks that have no exit nodes as there is no overlap with the globally routed internet at all. * Lower precision of time field? seconds precision seems overkill, and can even be harmful, there have been attacks that exploited high precision timestamps for mapping the current network topology. * (gmaxwell) If you care about space time field could be reduced to 16 bits easily. Turn it into a "time ago seen" quantized to 1 hour precision. (IIRC we quantize times to 2hrs regardless). * Rolling port into addr, or making the port optional, would make it possible to shave off two bytes for address types that don't have ports (however, all of the currently listed formats have a concept of port.). It could also be an optional data item (see below). * (gmaxwell) Optional (per-service) data could be useful for various things: * Node-flavors for striping (signalling which slice of the blocks the node has in selective pruning) * Payload for is alternative ports for other transports (e.g. UDP ports) * If we want optional flags. I guess the best thing would just be a byte to include the count of them, then a byte "type" for each one where the type also encodes if the payload is 0/8/16/32 bits. (using the two MSB of the type to encode the length). And then bound the count of them so that the total is still reasonably sized.

issue.title: test: Check that the version message does not leak the local address
[P2P] Begin Network Encapsulation
issue.body:
This is the finalization of the upstream PRs being tracked in #1374 to update much of our networking code to more closely follow upstream improvements. The following PRs are included here:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8466
  Do not shadow variables in networking code
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8606
  Fix some locks
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8085
  Begin encapsulation
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9289
  drop boost::thread_group
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8740
  No longer send local address in addrMe
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8661
  Do not set an addr time penalty when a peer advertises itself

Additionally, during conflict resolution and backporting of 8085, the following additional upstream PR was included:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8715
  only delete CConnman if it's been created


Still TODO in future PRs:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9037
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9441
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9609
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9626
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9708
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12381
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18584
